description:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/12.0.0a0/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py#L4026 is huge, in liberty-3 it's nearly 400 LOC.

We should really look at breaking that up in mitaka since it's too big to unit test properly and make sure we have the right coverage.
title: nova.virt.libvirt.driver._get_guest_config method is nearly 400 LOC and should be broken up

comments.content:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/12.0.0a0/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py#L4026 is huge, in liberty-3 it's nearly 400 LOC.

We should really look at breaking that up in mitaka since it's too big to unit test properly and make sure we have the right coverage.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content: Addressing config building stuff is one of the reasons for the creation of the host.py + guest.py classes.  i'd like to see all the config code moved out of driver.py and into designer.py, and only rely on host+guest classes + instance object
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~berrange

comments.content: To be clear, I'd expect a series of changes that break _get_guest_config into logical chunks (other private methods), e.g. getting the SPICE console guest config.  Then we could review that series in order.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Change abandoned by Michael Still (<email address hidden>) on branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/229382
Reason: This code hasn't been updated in a long time, and is in merge conflict. I am going to abandon this review, but feel free to restore it if you're still working on this.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Cleanup
=======

There are no open reviews for this bug report since more than 2 weeks.
To signal that to other contributors which might provide patches for
this bug, I switch the status from "In Progress" to "Confirmed" and
remove the assignee.
Feel free to add yourself as assignee and to push a review for it.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mzoeller
